title: Promoting Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) in Higher Education: UDL-Based Inclusive Pedagogy Workshop

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental understanding of higher education, general awareness of diversity concepts
context.additional_context: Workshop focused on building inclusive learning environments for students exposed to multicultural settings. Blended class combining online (lectures, case analysis) and offline (small-group discussions, hands-on activities) components

learning_goals: Learners can design lecture materials considering diverse learning needs by applying Universal Design for Learning (UDL) principles.
Using inclusive pedagogy, learners can develop three or more classroom activities that contribute to reducing marginalization in the lecture environment.

Learners can analyze three DEI (Diversity, Equity, Inclusion)-related cases, propose two actionable strategies to address equity issues in educational settings, and achieve over 80% satisfaction in peer evaluations and instructor feedback.

resources: UDL (Universal Design for Learning) Guidelines Document

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
